sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 4}. Compute (A △ B) × A and B × (B △ A) and verify that (A △ B) × A ≠ B × (B △ A), thereby proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
